title: FIIs sell USD 13.23 billion worth Indian stocks in CY25; IT, FMCG and power face biggest outflows
content:
73% of Indian investors make this mistake.
Are you one of them?
Here's what the data reveals:

📊 Key Numbers:
• Nifty: 24,712 (-0.75%)
• Sensex: 80,787 (-0.73%)
• FII: ₹+892 Cr | DII: ₹+3,456 Cr
• Top Sector: Banking (+2.2%)

🎯 What This Really Means:
While everyone focuses on the headline numbers...
The real story is in mid-cap momentum.
💡 The Opportunity:
→ Quality mid-caps are available at 2020 valuations

→ Smart money accumulating in chemicals
→ Risk-reward favorable for selective buying
💭 As Warren Buffett says:
'Be greedy when others are fearful.'
